title: War of the Five Houses

properties.name: description
properties.value: The War of the Five Houses was a civil war in Great Kourend near the end of the Fourth Age in the 121st - 123rd decade of Kourend's timeline. Despite the name, Arceuus never participated in the war.[1]

content:
War of the Five Houses
Date Late Fourth Age
Place Great Kourend
Outcome Crowning of King Kharedst I

The War of the Five Houses was a civil war in Great Kourend near the end of the Fourth Age in the 121st - 123rd decade of Kourend's timeline. Despite the name, Arceuus never participated in the war.[1]

During the 120th decade, King Agata IV was overthrown by the leaders of the five Houses, [2] presumably due to his mismanagement of the kingdom that left it ravaged by famine.[3] With no one next in line to the throne, an alliance between the Lovakengj and Piscarilius House formed to murder Lord Shayzien,[4] which was short lived as the two houses began to fight one another.[5] Meanwhile, the Hosidius House began to mobilise their forces,[6] and Lord Trobin Arceuus has begun to reinforce the defences of Arceuus, not wishing to participate in the civil war.[7]

Though the exact casualties are not known, the Hosidius House suffered massive casualties compared to the other Houses.[8] In addition, structures that were known to have been destroyed include Shayzia, once a castle belonging to the Shayzien House, and Forthos, the former seat of the Hosidius House.[9]

While the war was seen by some as a petty squabble[10] and a war of pride between the Houses,[11] the war ultimately lasted for twenty years. After the war ended, King Kharedst I took the throne of Great Kourend.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Sergeant Ricardo, Old School RuneScape. "Apparently they [Arceuus] didn't even properly fight in the War of the Five Houses. Still, I guess 'War of the Four Houses while House Arceuus watched' isn't as catchy a name."
  2. ↑ Shayzia military orders, Old School RuneScape. "... all five of the leaders had agreed to the plan to depose the gluttonous King Agata IV."
  3. ↑ Jagex. Postbag 27 - "Transcript:A fatherly Dad and some bloody insights", 4, by Jonathan. Old School RuneScape Postbags from the Hedge. "King Agata IV’s mismanagement left the kingdom ravaged by famine..."
  4. ↑ Shayzia military orders, Old School RuneScape. "It is with a heavy heart I must inform you of a great tragedy to befall our house. Lord Shayzien is dead. Murdered by a cowardly alliance between Lord Lovakengj and Lady Piscarillius."
  5. ↑ Shayzia military orders, Old School RuneScape. "The Lovakengj alliance with Lady Piscarillius was thankfully short lived, and there has been significant fighting between the two armies."
  6. ↑ Shayzia military orders, Old School RuneScape. "Meanwhile, Lady Hosidius has already rallied her forces as well, though it is unclear where her allegiances lie at this point."
  7. ↑ Shayzia military orders, Old School RuneScape. "Lord Arceuus has returned to Arceuus and reinforced the city. It seems he has no desire to participate in this conflict, but I suspect he will soon be given no choice."
  8. ↑ Jagex. Postbag 27 - "Transcript:A fatherly Dad and some bloody insights", 4, by Jonathan. Old School RuneScape Postbags from the Hedge. "Most young men and women were drafted into the houses’ personal armies during the war, and Hosidius did not fare well."
  9. ↑ Martin Holt, Old School RuneScape. "Forthos was the seat of the Hosidius family before it was destroyed in the War of the Five Houses."
  10. ↑ Bloody diary, Old School RuneScape. "The war started from some petty squabble between the lords and ladies of the five Houses, and I do not regret leaving at all."
  11. ↑ Rose's note, Old School RuneScape. "Find a great ruin that has withered and died. A seat of power, lost in a war of pride."

The '''War of the Five Houses''' was a civil war in [[Great Kourend]] near the end of the [[Fourth Age]] in the 121st - 123rd decade of [[Timeline|Kourend's timeline]]. Despite the name, [[Arceuus]] never participated in the war.{{CiteNPC|npc=Sergeant Ricardo|quote=Apparently they [Arceuus] didn't even properly fight in the War of the Five Houses. Still, I guess 'War of the Four Houses while House Arceuus watched' isn't as catchy a name.}}

During the 120th decade, [[King Agata IV]] was overthrown by the leaders of the five Houses, {{CiteText|text=Shayzia military orders|quote=... all five of the leaders had agreed to the plan to depose the gluttonous King Agata IV.}} presumably due to his mismanagement of the kingdom that left it ravaged by famine.{{CitePostbag|issue=27|author=[[Jonathan]]|letter=4|quote=King Agata IV’s mismanagement left the kingdom ravaged by famine...}} With no one next in line to the throne, an alliance between the Lovakengj and Piscarilius House formed to murder Lord Shayzien,{{CiteText|text=Shayzia military orders|quote=It is with a heavy heart I must inform you of a great tragedy to befall our house. Lord Shayzien is dead. Murdered by a cowardly alliance between Lord Lovakengj and Lady Piscarillius.}} which was short lived as the two houses began to fight one another.{{CiteText|text=Shayzia military orders|quote=The Lovakengj alliance with Lady Piscarillius was thankfully short lived, and there has been significant fighting between the two armies.}} Meanwhile, the Hosidius House began to mobilise their forces,{{CiteText|text=Shayzia military orders|quote=Meanwhile, Lady Hosidius has already rallied her forces as well, though it is unclear where her allegiances lie at this point.}} and [[Lord Trobin Arceuus]] has begun to reinforce the defences of Arceuus, not wishing to participate in the civil war.{{CiteText|text=Shayzia military orders|quote=Lord Arceuus has returned to Arceuus and reinforced the city. It seems he has no desire to participate in this conflict, but I suspect he will soon be given no choice.}}

Though the exact casualties are not known, the Hosidius House suffered massive casualties compared to the other Houses.{{CitePostbag|issue=27|author=[[Jonathan]]|letter=4|quote=Most young men and women were drafted into the houses’ personal armies during the war, and Hosidius did ''not'' fare well.}} In addition, structures that were known to have been destroyed include [[Shayzia Ruin|Shayzia]], once a castle belonging to the Shayzien House, and [[Forthos Ruin|Forthos]], the former seat of the Hosidius House.{{CiteNPC|npc=Martin Holt|quote=Forthos was the seat of the Hosidius family before it was destroyed in the War of the Five Houses.}}

While the war was seen by some as a petty squabble{{CiteText|text=Bloody diary|quote=The war started from some petty squabble between the lords and ladies of the five Houses, and I do not regret leaving at all.}} and a war of pride between the Houses,{{CiteText|text=Rose's note (A Kingdom Divided - 1){{!}}Rose's note|quote=Find a great ruin that has withered and died. A seat of power, lost in a war of pride.}} the war ultimately lasted for twenty years. After the war ended, [[King Kharedst I]] took the throne of Great Kourend.
